document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Ananteris Thorell (Scorpiones: Buthidae) from Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Ananteris Thorell (Scorpiones: Buthidae) from Colombia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Female holotype from Colombia , department of Meta, Villavicencio, Path El Carmen, 850– 1000m , into forest, Pitfall,
December 23 / 2005
, M. Viola (MPUJ-SCO- 245 ). One female paratype from Colombia , department of Meta, Villavicencio, Path El Carmen, 850–1000m , River Caño Blanco, under litter, ad hoc , at night,
April 18 / 2005
, R. Botero-Trujillo (MPUJ-SCO-039).
Etymology. Patronym dedicated to the author’s mother, Myriam Trujillo, in recognition to her great human quality and acknowledgement to her support and encouragement.

Diagnosis. Species of moderate size with predominantly brown coloration; anterior margin of the carapace with two concavities (
Fig. 6
); female pectines with 15–16 teeth; carinal formula of metasoma 10 : 10 : 10 : 6 : 5 ; metasomal carinae without spinoid granules. The new species may be easily distinguished from all other known Colombian
Ananteris
by the non-straight anterior margin of the carapace, the carinal formula of metasoma, and that
v 1
and
v 2
trichobothria are not aligned axially (
Fig. 13
). On the contrary, in the other four species the anterior margin of the carapace is straight, carinal formula is 10 : 10 : 8 : 8 : 5 , and
v 1
and
v 2
are aligned axially.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Known distribution of Colombian
Ananteris
.

FIGURES 3–7.
Ananteris myriamae
sp. nov.
, female holotype (MPUJ-SCO-245). 3. Right chelicera, dorsal view; 4. Coxosternal region, genital operculum and pectines; 5. Sternites I–III showing median hyaline and smooth areas, and booklung spiracles; 6. Anterior margin of the carapace; 7. Metasomal segments IV–V and telson, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Coloration. It is in accordance for all of the items with the description given above.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 8–13. Distribution of the trichobothria in female holotype
Ananteris myriamae
sp. nov.
(MPUJ-SCO-245). 8. Right femur, dorsal and external views; 9. Left femur, internal view; 10. Right patella, dorsal view; 11. Right patella, external view; 12. Right chela, external view; 13. Left chela, ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Morphology. The following features varied from the female holotype : pieces count on the pectines: middle lamellae 7 : 8 , teeth 16 : 16 .

Sympatric species. This species lives in sympatry with
Tityus (Archaeotityus) bastosi Lourenço
,
Tityus (Atreus) nematochirus Mello-Leitão
, and
Tityus (Tityus) gaffini Lourenço.
